para.text: Below is the complete list of things that are not supported yet or are known problems in the current build of X#.

li.text: DEFINE is supported but must have a type clause
ACCESS/ASSIGN must be both in same (partial) class. Cannot be spread over 2 parts of the class
Init procedures are not supported yet. This means that when you compile against the Vulcan VO SDK Classes you must manually add some code.
Some expressions that involve USUALs such as <USUAL> .and. <USUAL> may need a type cast to compile without errors.
PCall and PCallNative are not supported
Some operations on Usuals require manual casting
Some VO/Vulcan
are not implemented yet. The command line options are recognized but nothing is done with them

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: /cs: Case Sensitivity (the compiler is now always Case Insensitive)

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: /ppo: Write preprocessor output to a file

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: /vo1: Init and Axit methods get converted to CONSTRUCTOR and DESTRUCTOR

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: /vo6: Resolve typed ptr to Ptr

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: /vo 11: VO Compatible Numeric conversions
The preprocessor commands #command and #translate are not working yet
The compiler pragmas (#pragma warnings and #pragma options) do not work
The XML generation is not working
Parser errors need improvements
Erroneous code may generate compiler runtime errors
Compiler errors may be cryptic every now and then
The compiler is case insensitive. There may be a problem with case insensitive matching of interface member names. The case insensitivity cannot be switched off for now.

text.style: font-family:'Segoe UI'; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: We have also seen problems for classes where different member names are defined with a name that is only different in case.
Sometimes you may see a "Include file not found" error, where the file DOES exist. This seems to be a side effect of the codepage that was used to save the include files.
When you save the file as UTF8 (File Advanced Save Options in Visual Studio) then this problem almost always disappears.
No intellisense yet
No XPorter yet
No editors for VOBinary entities
